Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched like an ace and allowed just a solo homer to Juan Soto over 6 ¹/₃ innings.
Carlos Rodon allowed four runs — and three homers — in just 3 ¹/₃ innings as the Yankees’ supposed rotation advantage has turned on its head through two games.
Post-Match Reflections: Lefty Alex Vesia came in to get the final out with the bases loaded in the top of the ninth, as pinch-hitter Jose Trevino flied out to center.
1: Number of hits the Yankees got off Yamamoto.
